Sentence.sentence: While alternative estimates of the damage from carbon emissions differ, and it's especially hard to reckon the likely costs of possible catastrophic climate events, most estimates suggest substantial negative effects.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Social scientists say the differences arise in part because low-income parents have less money to spend on music class or preschool, and less flexible schedules to take children to museums or attend school events.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Many scientists believe that El Ni o events, caused by warming in the Pacific, are becoming more intense as a result of climate change.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: These catastrophic events caused more than 1.5 trillion dollars in economic losses.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: One day, I was invited to an important event, and I wanted to wear something special for it.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: To raise money for a forthcoming local sports event.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: To enhance his credibility with the audience, Larry had brought some slides of his family attending sports events.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Covering major events of the day in the city.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: During a megathrust event, all of that stress releases and some of the world’s most powerful earthquakes occur.

Sentence.sentence: I'll actually be taking photos during the big event as a wedding gift.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: In short, success in creating AI could be the biggest event in the history of our civilisation.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: It was caused by a megathrust event as the India plate moved beneath the Burma micro-plate.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Regardless of the author, it seems that the poem was inspired by a real event.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: The last time a major earthquake occurred along the Cascadia fault was in 1700, so officials worry that another event could occur any time.

Sentence.sentence: To prevent that event from becoming a catastrophe, first responders will join members of the public in rehearsals that involve communication, evacuation, search and rescue, and other scenarios.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"事故，事件"之意。
means: accident ：强调偶然或意外发生的不幸事情。
incident ：既可指小事件或附带事件，又可指政治上具有影响的事件或事变。
event ：可指任何大小事件，但尤指历史上的重大事件。
occurrence和happening这两个词多指日常生活中发生的一般事件，有时也指偶然发生的事。

Sentence.sentence: How does your reading proceed? Clearly you try to comprehend, in the sense of identifying meanings for individual words and working out relationships between them, drawing on your explicit knowledge of English grammar ( ' , 41) you begin to infer a context for the text, for insta4ce, by making decisions about what kind of speech event is involved: who is making the utterance, to whom, when and where.

lj.lj_ly: this will reduce the chance of serious injury in the event of an accident.
lj.lj_ls: 如果发生意外事故，这会减少重伤的可能性。

lj.lj_ly: in the event that an attack is launched, the defenders will have been significantly weakened by air attacks.
lj.lj_ls: 如果发动攻击，空中打击将使防卫者的防卫能力大大减弱。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 如果是那样的话；在那种情况下

lj.lj_ly: in that event, the US would incline toward a lifting of the arms embargo.
lj.lj_ls: 在那种情况下，美国可能会取消武器禁运。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 在任何情况下，不管怎样
在任何情况下，不管怎样

jx.jx_en_mean: If it should happen; in case.

entry.def: An event is something that happens, especially when it is unusual or important. You can use events to describe all the things that are happening in a particular situation.
entry.tran: 事件;（尤指）特殊事件，重大事件

example.ex: ...in the wake of recent events in Europe...
example.tran: 紧随欧洲最近发生的大事之后

entry.def: An event is a planned and organized occasion, for example a social gathering or a sports match.
entry.tran: （社交聚会、体育比赛等有计划、有组织的）活动

example.ex: The cross-country section of the three-day event was held here yesterday.
example.tran: 3日比赛中的越野项目昨天在这里举行。

entry.def: An event is one of the races or competitions that are part of an organized occasion such as a sports meeting.

example.ex: A solo piper opens Aberdeen Highland Games at 10am and the main events start at 1pm.
example.tran: 上午10点，一位风笛独奏家揭开了阿伯丁高地运动会的序幕，下午1点主要比赛项目开始。

entry.def: You use in the event of ,in the event that, and in that event when you are talking about a possible future situation, especially when you are planning what to do if it occurs.
entry.tran: 万一发生…；如果是那样子的话；假若…

example.ex: The bank has agreed to give an immediate refund in the unlikely event of an error being made...
example.tran: 万一出现错误——虽然这种几率微乎其微，银行同意立即退款。

example.ex: In the event that any part of the deal may be blocked, the rest would go ahead.
example.tran: 万一交易的某一部分受阻，其他部分将继续进行。

entry.def: You say in any event after you have been discussing a situation, in order to indicate that what you are saying is true or possible, in spite of anything that has happened or may happen.

example.ex: In any event, the bowling alley restaurant proved quite acceptable.
example.tran: 无论如何，那个保龄球场的餐厅证明还是很不错的。

entry.def: You say in the event after you have been discussing what could have happened in a particular situation, in order to indicate that you are now describing what actually did happen.

example.ex: 'Don't underestimate us', Norman Willis warned last year. There was, in the event, little danger of that.
example.tran: “别低估了我们，”诺曼·威利斯去年警告说。结果，什么事也没有。

means.word_mean: 1. something that happens at a given place and time

sentences.sentence: "in that event, the first possibility is excluded"
"it may rain in which case the picnic will be canceled"

means.word_mean: 3. a phenomenon located at a single point in space-time; the fundamental observational entity in relativity theory
4. a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon;

sentences.sentence: "the magnetic effect was greater when the rod was lengthwise"
"his decision had depressing consequences for business"
"he acted very wise after the event"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin eventus, from evenire 'result, happen', from e- (variant of ex-) 'out of' + venire 'come'

sentences.cn: 他一旦故去，所有财产都由希拉继承。
sentences.en: Sheila will inherit everything in the event of his death.

sentences.cn: 如果是那样的话，我们就得重新考虑我们的建议。
sentences.en: In that event, we will have to reconsider our offer.

sentences.cn: 万一发生事故就拨这个号码。
sentences.en: In the event of an accident, call this number.

sentences.cn: 我对考试提心吊胆，但其实我本不必担心，这次考试的确很容易。
sentences.en: I got very nervous about the exam, but in the event, I needn't have worried; it was really easy.

sentences.cn: 事后聪明谁都会。
sentences.en: Anyone can be wise after the event.

sentences.cn: 我想她会同意做的，但无论怎样，她只能说“不”。
sentences.en: I think she'll agree to do it but in any event, all she can say is ‘no ’.

sentences.en: The 800 metres is the fourth event of the afternoon.

sentences.en: In the normal course of events (= if things had happened as expected) she would have gone with him.

sentences.cn: 人人都因接二连三发生的怪事感到惊恐。
sentences.en: Everyone was frightened by the strange sequence of events .

sentences.cn: 我们现在作出的决定可能会对未来事情的发展产生影响。
sentences.en: The decisions we take now may influence the course of events (= the way things happen) in the future.

sentences.cn: 从后来发生的事看，这一决定证明是正确的。
sentences.en: In the light of later events the decision was proved right.

sentences.cn: [D] 发生在艾森豪威尔行政办公楼花岗岩墙内的历史事件涉及很多美国最著名的人物。
sentences.en: [D] Many of the most celebrated national figures have participated in historical events that have taken place within the EEOB' s granite walls.

sentences.cn: 随着经济的快速发展，我们比以往任何时候都更加需要那些在工作中能够发挥主动性并运用想象力“去应对突发事件”的人才。
sentences.en: In our rapidly changing economy, we more than ever need people in the workplace who can take initiative and exercise their imagination “to respond to unexpected events”.

sentences.cn: 虽然对碳排放造成的破坏的估计各不相同，而且计算可能发生的灾难性气候事件可能会造成的损失尤为困难，但多数预估都暗示了极大的负面影响。
sentences.en: While alternative estimates of the damage from carbon emissions differ, and it’s especially hard to reckon the likely costs of possible catastrophic climate events, most estimates suggest substantial negative effects.

sentences.cn: Love 说，这些极端事件还会继续发生。
sentences.en: He says extreme events will continue.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 但他又表示，只有当人们没有做好应对准备时，这些极端事件才会变成灾难。
sentences.en: But, he says extreme events become disasters only when people fail to prepare for them.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 我们如何才能阻止极端事件变成灾难？。
sentences.en: How can we stop extreme events from turning into disasters?.

sentences.cn: 这些灾难性事件造成了超过15,000 亿美元的经济损失。
sentences.en: These catastrophic events caused more than 5 trillion dollars in economic losses

sentences.cn: 然而，极端事件还会继续发生。
sentences.en: Extreme events, however, will continue to occur
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: McGaugh 邀请她来实验室，开始对她进行测试：他说出一个日子，让她说出那天发生的国际事件。

sentences.cn: 事实上, 梦境情感能帮助现实中的临床医学家治疗那些经历过意外事件创伤的病患.
sentences.en: In fact, dream emotions can help real therapists treat patients undergoing traumatic life events.

sentences.cn: 手工加代码处理UI事件.
sentences.en: Add code manually to handle UI events.

sentences.cn: 在此自然科学所强调的思想与事件之间的分离荡然无存了.
